title: Template Notes
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: Template Notes
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: Template Notes
text:
2 Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

library(pacman)

p_load(tidyverse, gghighlight, geomtextpath, scales, ggtext)

You can add options to executable code like this

set.seed(666)
selected_countries <- gapminder::gapminder |> 
  janitor::clean_names() |> 
  filter(
    year %in% c(1952, 2007),
    country %in% c(
      sample(levels(gapminder::gapminder$country), 15), 
      'Zimbabwe'
    )
  ) |> 
  mutate(
    year = factor(year),
    country = factor(country, levels = unique(country)) # reset levels
  )
selected_countries

# A tibble: 32 × 6
   country                continent year  life_exp      pop gdp_percap
   <fct>                  <fct>     <fct>    <dbl>    <int>      <dbl>
 1 Bosnia and Herzegovina Europe    1952      53.8  2791000       974.
 2 Bosnia and Herzegovina Europe    2007      74.9  4552198      7446.
 3 Congo, Dem. Rep.       Africa    1952      39.1 14100005       781.
 4 Congo, Dem. Rep.       Africa    2007      46.5 64606759       278.
 5 Greece                 Europe    1952      65.9  7733250      3531.
 6 Greece                 Europe    2007      79.5 10706290     27538.
 7 Haiti                  Americas  1952      37.6  3201488      1840.
 8 Haiti                  Americas  2007      60.9  8502814      1202.
 9 Iraq                   Asia      1952      45.3  5441766      4130.
10 Iraq                   Asia      2007      59.5 27499638      4471.
# ℹ 22 more rows


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
